title: Daily added sugar intake in England in 2008 - 2012 , by age group
summary: This is a bar chart representing Age Group in the x axis and Sugar intake in grams in the y axis.
Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years has the highest Sugar intake in grams and Children 1.5-3 years has the lowest Sugar intake in grams.
The highest Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years has 38.1 more Sugar intake in grams than the lowest Age Group Children 1.5-3 years.
min_summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Age Group, and Sugar intake in grams in each Age Group on the y axis.
Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years has the highest Sugar intake in grams and Children 1.5-3 years has the lowest Sugar intake in grams.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Age Group in the x axis and Sugar intake in grams in the y axis.
Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years has the highest Sugar intake in grams and Children 1.5-3 years has the lowest Sugar intake in grams.
The highest Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years has 38.1 more Sugar intake in grams than the lowest Age Group Children 1.5-3 years.
max_summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Age Group, and Sugar intake in grams in each Age Group on the y axis.
The Sugar intake in grams is highest at Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years and lowest at Age Group Children 1.5-3 years.
The highest Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years has 38.1 more Sugar intake in grams than the lowest Age Group Children 1.5-3 years.
Sugar intake in grams at Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years is 74.2 , second place is  at 36.1, and thirdly is Adults 19-64 years at 58.8.
The highest value 74.2 at Teenagers 11-18 years is almost 1.32 times larger than the average value 56.3.
The Sugar intake in grams is 281.5 if we add up values of all Age Groups.
